intro: Lepidium bonariense var. stenocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-carpel wallflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and compact growth habit. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or arid environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
